timeline.message:
change creation of connect and connects2i in tests

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lkral@redhat.com>

fix failed tests

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lkral@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText: Namespace should be generic here. I think it can occurred in all namespaces which we use.
timeline.author: Frawless
Frawless
Frawless

timeline.bodyText: also it would be nice to assure automatic deletion with deleteLater()
timeline.author: Frawless
Frawless

timeline.message:
fix failed tests

Signed-off-by: Lukas Kral <lkral@redhat.com>

timeline.bodyText:
You don't need the generics, just declare the parameter as HasMetadata resource. It would also be good to add javadoc. It wasn't immediately clear to me that the resource is something like KafkaConnector. And name probably isn't the best name for the 2nd parameter (the name of what?)
Finally I think the method name would be clearer with 'allow' it in, since this policy is allowing access
timeline.author: tombentley
tombentley
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -307,6 +312,84 @@ public static Service deployBridgeNodePortService(String bridgeExternalService,
             .endSpec().build();
     }
 
+    public static <T extends HasMetadata> NetworkPolicy applyNetworkPolicySettingsForResource(T resource, String name) {
+        NetworkPolicy networkPolicy = new NetworkPolicyBuilder()
+                .withNewApiVersion("networking.k8s.io/v1")
+                .withNewKind("NetworkPolicy")
+                .withNewMetadata()
+                    .withName(resource.getMetadata().getName() + "-allow")
+                .endMetadata()
+                .withNewSpec()
+                    .addNewIngress()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(8083)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(9404)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(8080)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                      .endIngress()
+                    .withNewPodSelector()
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/cluster", resource.getMetadata().getName())
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/kind", resource.getKind())
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/name", name)
+                    .endPodSelector()
+                    .withPolicyTypes("Ingress")
+                .endSpec()
+                .build();
+
+        deleteLater(kubeClient().getClient().network().networkPolicies().inNamespace(ResourceManager.kubeClient().getNamespace()).createOrReplace(networkPolicy));
+        return networkPolicy;
+    }
+
+    public static NetworkPolicy allowNetworkPolicies(String namespace) {

timeline.author: tombentley
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -307,6 +312,84 @@ public static Service deployBridgeNodePortService(String bridgeExternalService,
             .endSpec().build();
     }
 
+    public static <T extends HasMetadata> NetworkPolicy applyNetworkPolicySettingsForResource(T resource, String name) {
+        NetworkPolicy networkPolicy = new NetworkPolicyBuilder()
+                .withNewApiVersion("networking.k8s.io/v1")
+                .withNewKind("NetworkPolicy")
+                .withNewMetadata()
+                    .withName(resource.getMetadata().getName() + "-allow")
+                .endMetadata()
+                .withNewSpec()
+                    .addNewIngress()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(8083)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(9404)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                        .addNewPort()
+                            .withNewPort(8080)
+                            .withNewProtocol("TCP")
+                        .endPort()
+                      .endIngress()
+                    .withNewPodSelector()
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/cluster", resource.getMetadata().getName())
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/kind", resource.getKind())
+                        .addToMatchLabels("strimzi.io/name", name)
+                    .endPodSelector()
+                    .withPolicyTypes("Ingress")
+                .endSpec()
+                .build();
+
+        deleteLater(kubeClient().getClient().network().networkPolicies().inNamespace(ResourceManager.kubeClient().getNamespace()).createOrReplace(networkPolicy));
+        return networkPolicy;
+    }
+
+    public static NetworkPolicy allowNetworkPolicies(String namespace) {
+        NetworkPolicy networkPolicy = new NetworkPolicyBuilder()
+                .withNewApiVersion("networking.k8s.io/v1")
+                .withNewKind("NetworkPolicy")
+                .withNewMetadata()
+                    .withName("global-network-policy")
+                .endMetadata()
+                .withNewSpec()
+                    .withNewPodSelector()
+                    .endPodSelector()
+                    .addNewIngress()
+                    .endIngress()
+                    .withPolicyTypes("Ingress")
+                .endSpec()
+                .build();
+
+        deleteLater(kubeClient().getClient().network().networkPolicies().inNamespace(namespace).createOrReplace(networkPolicy));
+        LOGGER.info("Network policy successfully set to allow-all");
+
+        return networkPolicy;
+    }
+
+    public static NetworkPolicy denyNetworkPolicies(String namespace) {
+        NetworkPolicy networkPolicy = new NetworkPolicyBuilder()
+                .withNewApiVersion("networking.k8s.io/v1")
+                .withNewKind("NetworkPolicy")
+                .withNewMetadata()
+                    .withName("global-network-policy")
+                .endMetadata()
+                .withNewSpec()
+                    .withNewPodSelector()
+                    .endPodSelector()
+                    .withPolicyTypes("Ingress")
+                .endSpec()
+                .build();
+
+

timeline.bodyText:
So as i can see basically you change all our Kafka CR methods is a way that every time when we deploy for instance KafkaConnect, it must be with the additional parameter allowNetworkPolicyAccess. Would it be better to overload  method and encapsulate default value of allowNetworkPolicyAccess?
Currently -> You have only these master methods with lot of parameters.

`public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas, boolean allowNetworkPolicyAccess)`

Goal -> Master method with auxiliary methods like 

1) public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas, boolean allowNetworkPolicyAccess)
2) public static DoneableKafkaConnect kafkaConnect(String name, int kafkaConnectReplicas)

where is second example you will need to decide has default value for the third argument of method in a 1).
Does it make sense?
timeline.author: see-quick

timeline.bodyText: This one i would move to KubeClusterResource class what do you think @Frawless ?
timeline.author: see-quick

replies.bodyText: Yes, I already suggested it I think (or at least I wanted:D )
replies.author: Frawless

timeline.bodyText: I think this is too wide. This will open the network even for the CO and therefore the tests will not really test that the CO is able to deal with this on its own. I think you need to make this more specific to allow only connections for the tests.
timeline.author: scholzj

replies.bodyText: AFAIU CO deal with NP by it's own in case that Kafka Connector is used. In that case we don't apply any NP changes and we communicate with Connect only via operator. I am not sure about mm2 and bridge atm. Is that what you mean we should do?
replies.author: Frawless

replies.bodyText: But that is not right, or? That means that this test will test the known issues, but never found any new issues in other areas. AFAIK we have this problem repeatedly and we found about these issues only form user issues. So we need to make sure this test not only covers the known cases but has a chance to find new cases as well.
replies.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: If I read the code right, this does not allow or disable the network policies. Thsi is rather a swicth between default-to-allow and default-to-deny network policies. So I think we should change the name to make it more clear.
timeline.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: Again, the naming here might be confusing since it doesn't deny or allow network policies. It basically just defines their default behaviour if they are already enabled. If they are disabled, this will do nothing.
timeline.author: scholzj

timeline.bodyText: Again, the naming here might be confusing since it doesn't deny or allow network policies. It basically just defines their default behaviour if they are already enabled. If they are disabled, this will do nothing.

timeline.bodyText: In all this deployments of Kafka connect will be really great to have encapsulation of this third parameter for the default value...
